thread.title: Another terror attack on tourists boarding sightseeing boats in Bangkok failed
thread.title_full: Another terror attack on tourists boarding sightseeing boats in Bangkok failed

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Another terror attack on tourists boarding sightseeing boats in Bangkok failed
text:
Terror: Tourists in Bangkok under attack for the second day Another terror attack on tourists boarding sightseeing boats in Bangkok failed   
Aug 18, 2015 eTN   
It may have killed more tourists in Bangkok today, but luckily no one got hurt, when a small explosive devise missed its target. 
A man threw an explosive near the busy River Express pier on the city's Chao Phraya river from the Taksin Bridge in Bangkok. 
It landed in a canal instead of landing in the water or on the pier where it would have most likely killed more tourists. At the time of the incident tourists were lined up to take boat tours. 
The Taksin Bridge is a bridge crossing the Chao Phraya river in Bangkok, Thailand. 
Underneath the bridge is the River Express pier and this is the start for many tourist boarding sightseeing boat tours. 
The river is popular for tourists from around the world to explore Bangkok from a boat. It's in walking distance to the Bangkok Skytrain, the Wat Suan Plu Temple,the Shangri La Hotel, The Marriott and many other tourist spots. On the opposite side of the river is the legendary Oriental Hotel. 
Reports indicate the explosive device was a hand grenade. However, it missed its intended target and fell into the river below, before exploding beneath the surface. 
Police are currently at the scene and have sealed off the area
